Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
1. pick a good long term project so worst case you just hodl until it recovers.
2. wait for it to be oversold, that is when the prices is below the fast MA, which is below the medium MA which is below the long term MA.
3. wait until it is overbought, that is when price is above the fastMA, that is above the medium term MA, which is above the long term MA.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is very boring and you might go months between trades, but it is almost guaranteed to have a decent ROI. Spend the downtime learning

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use FA for selection, TA for timing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alternatively: try to pick every weekly/daily top and bottom using your powerful psychic powers. Get a 100% success rate and quadruple your money every week. Note this option is only recommended for powerful psychics with real precog abilities

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: aka insider information

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Reality though, this seems like solid advice.

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: we had number 3 conditions recently on the 1h charts

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically short term day trading is impossible to be anywhere 100% correct and you end up kicking yourself for missing the last x% of the upmove, or whatever you didnt predict 100% correct. so psychologically it is easy to get into a negative feedback

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1h charts ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not 1 minute charts?

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: 1 minute charts are for folks with ADHD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you sell on a short term overbought, then you would end up waiting a long time for the oversold. so depends on your trading cycle. if you like to make a few trades per year and make 50%+, dont trade 1 minute or 1 hr charts, too fast

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the faster the chart, the more theoretical gains possible from the percentage changes, but also the most losses are likely to happen.

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: I suspect there are folks trying to trade on the 1 minute charts most of the time
